paper_abstract: The social component of Web 2.0-related services offers users many opportunities for interface personalization. Learning environments offer an ideal case study because they require customization and must adapt to life-long learning needs in a rapidly changing environment. Consequently, researchers are already starting to define the latest wave of next-generation e-learning systems. The authors analyze current trends in e-learning architecture evolution and identify merits and limitations. They also describe a new architecture that captures the needs of both formal (instructor-led) and informal (student-led) learning environments.
